main event: An object was observed by personnel at Miyako Jima Air Station during the early morning hours, resembling a star and changing in appearance and size.
interesting points: The object had a compass heading of 190 degrees and was estimated to be moving at approximately 600 mph according to radar measurements., Observers described its appearance changing from a point of light to a distinct object., The radar system was reportedly defective, leading to a lack of further data., The object's movement appeared erratic and was tracked for about five minutes., No conclusions could be drawn regarding the identity of the object.
location: Miyako Jima Air Station, Okinawa, Japan
witness description: personnel at the Miyako Jima Air Station
